components.description:
A hunk of unspecified meat on a white bone, as associated with cartoon cavepersons or food in anime and manga (Japanese ano niku, “that meat”).

This emoji was shown as a steak in Android 4.4.
components.title: Meat on Bone

description:
A hunk of unspecified meat on a white bone, as associated with cartoon cavepersons or food in anime and manga (Japanese ano niku, “that meat”).

This emoji was shown as a steak in Android 4.4.
title: Meat on Bone

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Food symbol
emoji_net_data.definition: Meat on a bone in a classic cartoon-like style, seen in manga/anime.¬†Known as ‚ÄúAno Niku‚Äù, meaning ‚ÄúThat Meat you see in Manga or Anime‚Äú or m http://emojipedia.org/meat-on-bone/
emoji_net_data.name: meat on bone

bn:00087460v: To consume something solid or semi-solid (usually food) by putting it into the mouth and eventually swallowing it.
To consume (something solid or semi-solid, usually food) by putting it into the mouth and swallowing it.

bn:00054026n: The edible flesh of animals, especially that of mammals.
Meat is the flesh of an animal which is eaten.
Meat is animal flesh that is eaten as food.
The flesh of an animal used as food.
The flesh of animals (including fishes and birds and snails) used as food

bn:00011999n: Rigid organs that constitute part of the endoskeleton of vertebrates
A composite material consisting largely of calcium phosphate and collagen and making up the skeleton of most vertebrates.
Rigid connective tissue that makes up the skeleton of vertebrates
Bones are rigid organs that constitute part of the endoskeleton of vertebrates.

bn:00018265n: Domesticated fowl, primarily a source of food
The flesh of a chicken used for food
The flesh of the domesticated chicken (Gallus gallus domesticus).
The chicken is a domesticated fowl, a subspecies of the Red Junglefowl.
Chickens are a domesticated fowl, a subspecies of the Red Junglefowl.
A hen; a cooked chicken; a chicken dressed for cooking.
A domestic fowl, Gallus gallus, especially when young

bn:01799926n: Meat on the bone, also called bone-in meat is meat that is sold with some or all of the bones included in the cut or portion, i.e. meat that has not been filleted.

bn:00035650n: Any substance consumed to provide nutritional support for the body. For prepared ready-to-eat food, use dish: Q746549.
Any substance consumed by living organisms to sustain life.
Any substance that can be consumed by living organisms, especially by eating, in order to sustain life.
Any solid substance (as opposed to liquid) that is used as a source of nourishment
Food is any substance consumed to provide nutritional support for the body.
